CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 16, 1960, pg. 5 reads: "200 Strong for 'Sarah' - The Young Democrats, representing 200 members of the 13th Ward, have declared: "We are solidly behind Sarah Kirk and her entire slate." This endorsement came last Sunday in the home of Mrs. Gloria Paylor, 7334 Idlewild St., where the group met.  Officers and members of the Young Democrats are, left to right; Robert Brown, vice president; Mrs. Juanita Connor, secretary; Robert Woods Carter, candidate for committeeman in the 11th District; Lawrence Connors, treasurer; William White, deputy constable of the 13th Ward, and candidate for committeeman in the Sixth District; Mrs. Sarah Kirk, alderman and chairman of the 13th Ward. - Harris photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of officers and members of the Young Democrats, from left: Robert Brown, Juanita Connor, Robert Woods Carter, Lawrence Connors, William White, gathered with endorsed candidate Alderman Sarah Kirk, gathered in home of Georgia Paylor, 7334 Idlewild Street
